comments:
Since I've discussed already in the News-Group I heavily doubt a Bug:

> >>>I'm currently in the stage of joining a team which already build some
> >>>sources + Branches. Since this is already existing for some time, there is
> >>>already a given structure, like the following:
> >>>
> >>>Head:    Tags/Branch:
> >>>- Dir1   News     Old    NotSoOld
> >>>- Dir2   News            NotSoOld
> >>>- Dir3   News     Old
> >>>
> >>>
> >>>Now the task is to work in Branch 'Old'. I figured out that I can get for
> >>>eg. Dir1 the Tag 'Old' like the following: 
> >>>
> >>>- Find a File in Dir1
> >>>- Right-click with Tag with Existing Tag
> >>>- Configure Tags
> >>>- Select a Tag  ('Old')
> >>>- Add Checked Tags
> >>>- Cancel
> >>>
> >>>=> Now I have in Branches:
> >>>
> >>>- Old
> >>>- - Dir1Old
> >>>
> >>>So, now it's included in the Branch. BUT only for the selected Dir1. Same
> >>>has to be done for Dir3.
> >>>
> >>>Question: How to get ALL Branches at once for 'Old'? i.e. Systems finds
> >>>ALL files for this Branch.
> >>>
> >>>Is it also possible to change to name of 'Dir1Old' to 'Dir1_Old'? ie. to
> >>>make a '_' for all listed and displayed dirs?

> > Michael Valenta wrote:
> > 
> > 
> >>I would suggest you have a look at the Help doc shipped with Eclipse. It 
> >>has a section Discovering Branches and Versions which describes how to 
> >>do this.
> >>


> > OK, I found the refered Help Topic. But seems like I've tried this
> > already, because if I do so, I get either an Error or NO result :(
> > 
> > Selecting the Branch, Refresh Branches, Select ALL directories => 
> > Error: 'The Server didn't provide any additional information.'
> > Selecting according to the given example, Dir3, no Error, but also NOTHING
> > happens, ie. no Dir3Old is added.
> > 
> > => Did I made something wrong or is this a Bug?
> > 
> > LeO

Michael Valenta wrote:

> The branch refresh uses the same tag discovery mechanism as Configure 
> Branches and Versions do if one works, the other should work as well. Is 
> there anything in the log file (found in the .metadata directory of your 
> workspace). Also, what server version and Eclipse version are you using?


Answer:

In the log-File I do not find any kind of specific Error.
Eclipse 3.0M8 and CVS-Server 1.11 under Solaris with pserver-connection.

So, what assume is that the Error  'The Server didn't provide any additional
information.' blocks the further Configuration-mechanism and therefore the last
dialog is not shown (from which I can only assume it exists). And frankly said,
don't know what the Error refers to, cause the Tagging with serval dirs works fine.
To be more precise, it's CVS 1.11.5

Please follow the steps available at the following URl for getting a trace of 
the communications between the client and the server. This may help us 
determine what is wrong.


http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-vcm-
home/docs/online/cvs_features2.0/cvs-faq.html#misc_0

Some comments:

1) Where to find the logs for it?
a) I assume it should be in the .metadata/.log.
b) If so, at startup, I get:

c) if not=> Can you please inform me, where to find the correct one?

2) I found the source for the Error-Message, where it stops. Ie. I have included
the Dir 'CVSROOT'. When unselecting this one, then I don't get an Error for the
'Configure Branches and Versions.'

3) BUT nothing more happens, ie. I don't get any additional Window where I can
specify anything. Just, without any comment the Window closes and that's it.

Conclusion?

What is "de.mmeggs.cvsupdatecheck"? Please remove any third party plugins you 
are using and see if that helps. Also, you may want to inform the providers of 
that plugin that CVS has changed considerably in M8 and their use of non-API 
code is broken.

As for the link I gave you, the output should appear in the DOS console (hence 
the use of java.exe instead of javaw.exe).

Hm', currently the system runs amok. I unfortunately switched off my computer
after a Syncronize, just in the middle of it (ie. synchronized finished and one
file to compare). Read your response, deleted the refered Plugin and now the
computer is working for at least 30minutes in the CVS-update. I canceled also
the task, but still hangs around with 'Refreshing workspace'. 

Doesn't look like the system could be brought back to life :( I'll try it later
after some holidays.:(
Any idea, how I can revive the workspace?

Your best bet is to try and wait it out. When you say CVS-update, do you mean 
Updating Synchronization state? If so, try closing all instances of the sync 
view and restarting.
Waiting for input from user.

Sorry, for long no time - response, but holiday and easter are little bit more
important ;)

So, back I restart the Eclipse and really after the approx. 30 min. the Eclipse
could be restarted. I've selected once again the dialog Refresh Branches, and
error reoccurs once again. Main difference now, is that after the Error-message
the window with the selectable dirs from HEAD remains and does not close.
Unselecting the CVSROOT, error does not occur, but also no additional window
with the available branches. So, still I can't get a list of all CVS-Branches at
once.

The only relevant Error could be found in the .log-file and I don't think it has
something to do with CVS:

Q: Is the setting from Comment #2 still correct, because my dir looks like

\plugins\org.eclipse.team.core_3.0.0

but the setting is:

org.eclipse.team.cvs.core/debug=true
...

I've tried also

org.eclipse.team.cvs.core_3.0.0/debug=true

but not additional trace available.

Yes, the setting in comment #2 should work. Here's another method to use:

1) Start Eclipse with the -vm C:\path\to\java.exe -debug -consolelog" options 
(note the ue of java.exe instead of javaw.exe).

2) On the CVS preferences page, enable the option to dislay detailed protocol 
output.

Now when you run a CVS command, there should be output to the DOS console 
associated with Eclipse (you may need to increase the line buffer if to get 
all the information).

Don't wanna be a rockhaed, but wouldn't it be useful, if that 2) would have been
mentioned somewhere? On the link for comment #2 I couldn't find it (at the very
first glimpse)!

I'm enclosing the log-file. Two comments from my side:

1) I did previously some additional check out, just to see, if CVS works.
2) I only updated the CVSROOT, and looking into the Trace it reveals something
like permission denied. I've tried also too Open "commitinfo" which failed with
message: 
"The server reported an error while performing the "cvs status" command.

But a reason for not seeing something like complete list of available Branches
remains still unclear.

Created an attachment (id=9434)
Configure Branches and ...

Created an attachment (id=9435)
Viewing one specifc file

I see what the problem is. By default Eclipse looks for tags on the .project 
file but your project does not have a .project in the repository. On the 
Configure branches and Versions dialog, you can change the auto-refresh file. 
Once you have done this, the Refresh should discover new tags.

I see what you mean, but this does not achieve what I was originally looking
for. Yeah, I can now deselect for each Directory the .project-file. Since we
have 30 dirs + 20 files in top-level a lot of work. Isn't there a simpler
approach to specify, there is no default file .project available???

AND I've tried it with one directory to remove this .project. But you know what
happened? Accepting and reopening, same default-file was available althought
removed!!!

Is it also related with this ticket:

An Update in the Resource-View will update the existing Files. But if in the
Repository exists a new File this update does not take the new File with it.
I've seen this when I try to update the whole Project, but when I try to do it
on the Dir-level itself, then I'll get the missing files.

Same issue as this bug or something else?

Comment 17 is not related to this bug report. If this behavior is 
reproducable, you should open a separate bug with the steps to reproduce and 
all the particulars (Eclipse version, CVS server version, etc.).
Auto-refresh will now use log command if the auto-refresh file(s) do not exist.
Verified comment 19 in 3.1M4
